Sequence Information.Peptide Name: PGLa-AM1 (natural AMPs; frog, amphibians, animals; Ala-rich; UCLL1c; XXA; BBL; PGLa-AM2: inactive, MIC >200 uM)
Sequence Information.Source: skin secretions, the octoploid frog,Xenopus amieti(Pipidae), Africa

Literature Information.Literature: Active against E. coli (25 uM) and S. aureus (MIC 50 uM). Beta-cells without cytotoxicity at concentrations up to 3 uM. The peptide can bind to LPS (McLean et al., 2014). It has the potential to be developed into molecules that treat patients with Type 2 diabetes (T2D) (Owolabi BO et al., 2017). Updated 4/2017; 5/2019; 7/2020.
Literature Information.Author: Conlon JM, Al-Ghaferi N, Ahmed E, Meetani MA, Leprince J, Nielsen PF.2010
Literature Information.Title: Orthologs of magainin, PGLa, procaerulein-derived, and proxenopsin-derived peptides from skin secretions of the octoploid frog Xenopus amieti (Pipidae).
